talk40:
I don't see how you can increase your
<clr:0000>Stamina Vessels<clr:ffff> any further.
talk41:
Careful... Give away any more of your
<clr:0000>Heart Containers<clr:ffff>, and it could have a
fatal effect on your health.
talk42:
Have a care... Give me any more of your
<clr:0000>Stamina Vessels<clr:ffff>, and you may not have
the strength to stand.
talk77:
A dealer in life and power... That was
me, once.

Alas, my life-for-money bargains didn't
sit well with the Goddess Hylia.

She turned me into this stone statue
long, long ago...

Even then, I continued my bargains as a
statue in a village. Still, the Goddess did
not like what I was doing.
I was banished from the main street to the
outskirts of town, scorned and neglected.
But that was not enough for her.
Again I was sent away. I spent time
trapped in a pond, with only fish for
company. And finally...here.
Perhaps another might have learned a
lesson from this. But I have not.

No, I have only been biding my time for
the moment when someone who can hear
me appears. Someone such as you.
I'm sure we can reach a beneficial
arrangement. I have dealt only with fish
for too long. And fish make terrible deals.
talk43:
No, no... I'm afraid you already have all
the <clr:0000>Heart Containers<clr:ffff> you possibly can.
talk78:
Hold still, and don't fret. I'll take care of
everything. This won't hurt a bit.
talk44:
No, no... I'm afraid you already have all
the <clr:0000>Stamina Vessels<clr:ffff> you possibly can.
talk47:
I'm currently without any of your
<clr:0000>essences<clr:ffff>. Are you in the mood to sell?
talk16: Then... What are you still doing here?
talk18:
It's simple. I'll give you <clr:0000>100 rupees <clr:ffff>to
take one of your <clr:0000>Heart Containers<clr:ffff> or a<clr:0000>
Stamina Vessel <clr:ffff>off your hands.
You can have one back for <clr:0000>120 rupees<clr:ffff>.
And if it's not the same one you gave
me, why, I won't tell a soul.
Exchanging a <clr:0000>Heart Container<clr:ffff> for a<clr:0000>
Stamina Vessel<clr:ffff>, or vice versa, for only
<clr:0000>20 rupees <clr:ffff>sounds good, doesn't it?
You must be salivating at the idea, so
let's go ahead and strike our bargain.
talk65:
My touch is as subtle as ever...


Note how I took that <clr:0000>essence <clr:ffff>from you
without leaving a mark.
talk31: Come to tamper with your <clr:0000>essence<clr:ffff>, yes?
talk32:
No, eh? Fa ha ha... If you say so.


Just know that I'm willing to strike a
bargain with anyone who can hear
my voice.
talk33:
I still have <clr:0000><sp:2:e:34:2e004e0070006300440065006d006f006e005300740061007400750065005f0055007400750077006100530075006d00ffff00cd><clr:ffff> of your <clr:0000>essences<clr:ffff>...
Shall I return another <clr:0000>Heart Container<clr:ffff>
to you?

talk34:
I wouldn't object if you wanted to give
me more <clr:0000>Heart Containers<clr:ffff>.
talk69: Which type of <clr:0000>essence <clr:ffff>shall I grant you?
talk80:
What's this?


You haven't received even one more
<clr:0000>Heart Container<clr:ffff> or <clr:0000>Stamina Vessel<clr:ffff>?

Such a pity... I was eager to help you
with a minor <clr:0000>transaction<clr:ffff>. But not if you
have nothing to trade.
Consult a <clr:0000>Goddess Statue <clr:ffff>to improve
yourself, and then return here to pray.

talk84:
Fa ha ha... Did you think I'd
deceived you?

Perish the thought. I hope that ours will
be a long and profitable relationship.

So which will it be?
talk04:
Very interesting choice... Just don't
come crying to me later.
talk39:
I don't see how you can increase your
<clr:0000>Heart Containers<clr:ffff> any further.
talk05:
I know from swindles, boy, and I can
plainly tell that you don't have the
<clr:0000>120 rupees<clr:ffff> required.
talk52:
Ahhh... So there are some who still
pay me homage.
talk87: A wise choice. Now, remain still.
talk53: You don't say... You can hear my voice?
talk88:
You look skeptical. Not to worry.


Money and life are all as one to me.


If you're ready to begin, then first you
must sell me either type of <clr:0000>essence <clr:ffff>for
<clr:0000>100 rupees<clr:ffff>.
If you want to buy an essence back,
the price rises to <clr:0000>120 rupees<clr:ffff>.

Before you cry foul, know that you may
choose which one I return to you:
a <clr:0000>Heart Container<clr:ffff> or a <clr:0000>Stamina Vessel<clr:ffff>.
I'm eager to help tamper with your
essence anytime you want to return
and pray here.
talk54:
Now, that is a surprise.


What were you praying for? Long life?
Wealth, like so many of your kind?

Whichever it was, you came to the
right place.
talk89: Now then, shall we strike a bargain?
